meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time
meanings.sent1: The conductor synchronises the musicians to start playing together.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light synchronises the flow of vehicles at the intersection.
meanings.sent3: The clock synchronises with the alarm, waking me up on time.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves synchronise perfectly with the music, like a well-choreographed routine.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers move in perfect harmony, creating a beautiful performance.

meanings.definition: To coordinate in time or cause to occur at the same rate or time
meanings.sent1: The coach synchronises the team's movements during the game.
meanings.sent2: The software program synchronises data between different devices.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clapping of the audience made the comedian pause in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized blinking of fireflies in the night sky was a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized fireworks display lit up the sky in a breathtaking spectacle.
